result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin A. Barnes

8:36 AM Defendant Benjamin A. Barnes in court.  Attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon in court for Benjamin A. Barnes.  Attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. Defense request jury trial and final pre-trial. 
BTC: Matter set for trial and final pre-trial. All pre-trial motions to be filed to final pre-trial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on January 17, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

9:00 AM Defendant Benjamin A. Barnes in court.  Attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon in court for Benjamin A. Barnes.  Attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Defense indicates the defendant just reviewed some photos they received last week, requests another status date. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Racine County Alternatives Program- Progress Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim N.T (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Defendant is to be placed on HOUSE ARREST with GPS monitoring through Racine County Alternatives Program (717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine). Defendant MAY ONLY BE RELEASED to the supervision of RCAP.  Exceptions to house arrest are court, attorney and defendant's medical appointments as well as employment verified with RCAP. Note: $120 advance fee for installment of the GPS must be paid prior to the release from jail. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
AMENDED 05-25-22 DEFENDANT MAY BE REMOVED FROM GPS MONITORING.
NG plea entered.

9:13 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin A Barnes in court.  Attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon in court for Benjamin A Barnes. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense has filed a bond motion, moving to remove the house arrest monitoring. 
State objects to the bond modification at this time.
BTC: Motion to modify bond granted, deft may be removed from GPS monitoring. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on July 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
